segment.source: How to Configure Access to Packages by Using the Management Console
segment.target: How to Configure Access to Packages by Using the Management Console

segment.source: How to Configure Access to Packages by Using the Management Console
segment.target: How to Configure Access to Packages by Using the Management Console

segment.source: How to Configure Access to Packages by Using the Management Console
segment.target: How to Configure Access to Packages by Using the Management Console

segment.source: Before you deploy an App-V 5.1 virtualized package, you must configure the Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) security groups that will be allowed to access and run the applications.
segment.target: Before you deploy an App-V 5.1 virtualized package, you must configure the Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) security groups that will be allowed to access and run the applications.

segment.source: The security groups may contain computers or users.
segment.target: The security groups may contain computers or users.

segment.source: Entitling a package to a computer group publishes the package globally to all computers in the group.
segment.target: Entitling a package to a computer group publishes the package globally to all computers in the group.

segment.source: Use the following procedure to configure access to virtualized packages.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to configure access to virtualized packages.

segment.source: To grant access to an App-V 5.1 package
segment.target: To grant access to an App-V 5.1 package

segment.source: Find the package you want to configure:
segment.target: Find the package you want to configure:

segment.source: Open the App-V 5.1 Management console.
segment.target: Open the App-V 5.1 Management console.

segment.source: To display the AD ACCESS page, right-click the package to be configured, and select Edit active directory access.
segment.target: To display the AD ACCESS page, right-click the package to be configured, and select Edit active directory access.

segment.source: Alternatively, select the package and click EDIT in the AD ACCESS pane.
segment.target: Alternatively, select the package and click EDIT in the AD ACCESS pane.

segment.source: Provision a security group for the package:
segment.target: Provision a security group for the package:

segment.source: Go to the FIND VALID ACTIVE DIRECTORY NAMES AND GRANT ACCESS page.
segment.target: Go to the FIND VALID ACTIVE DIRECTORY NAMES AND GRANT ACCESS page.

segment.source: Using the format mydomaingroupname, type the name or part of the name of an Active Directory group object, and click Check.
segment.target: Using the format mydomaingroupname, type the name or part of the name of an Active Directory group object, and click Check.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Ensure that you provide an associated domain name for the group that you are searching for.
segment.target: Ensure that you provide an associated domain name for the group that you are searching for.

segment.source: To grant access to the package, select the desired group and click Grant Access.
segment.target: To grant access to the package, select the desired group and click Grant Access.

segment.source: The newly added group is displayed in the AD ENTITIES WITH ACCESS pane.
segment.target: The newly added group is displayed in the AD ENTITIES WITH ACCESS pane.

segment.source: To accept the default configuration settings and close the AD ACCESS page, click Close.
segment.target: To accept the default configuration settings and close the AD ACCESS page, click Close.

segment.source: To customize configurations for a specific group, click the ASSIGNED CONFIGURATIONS drop-down and select Custom.
segment.target: To customize configurations for a specific group, click the ASSIGNED CONFIGURATIONS drop-down and select Custom.

segment.source: To configure the custom configurations, click EDIT.
segment.target: To configure the custom configurations, click EDIT.

segment.source: After you grant access, click Close.
segment.target: After you grant access, click Close.

segment.source: To remove access to an App-V 5.1 package
segment.target: To remove access to an App-V 5.1 package

segment.source: Find the package you want to configure:
segment.target: Find the package you want to configure:

segment.source: Open the App-V 5.1 Management console.
segment.target: Open the App-V 5.1 Management console.

segment.source: To display the AD ACCESS page, right-click the package to be configured, and select Edit active directory access.
segment.target: To display the AD ACCESS page, right-click the package to be configured, and select Edit active directory access.

segment.source: Alternatively, select the package and click EDIT in the AD ACCESS pane.
segment.target: Alternatively, select the package and click EDIT in the AD ACCESS pane.

segment.source: Select the group you want to remove, and click DELETE.
segment.target: Select the group you want to remove, and click DELETE.

segment.source: To close the AD ACCESS page, click Close.
segment.target: To close the AD ACCESS page, click Close.

segment.target: Got a suggestion for App-V?
